properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Lake Fyans, Pomonal

  • This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 1.47pm on Monday 23 December 2024.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap road that is not yet under control.  
  • The bushfire is travelling in a northerly direction
  • Milder weather conditions overnight and this morning has slowed the spread of fire for now, but the situation can change at any time. 
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Weather forecasts indicate warmer temperatures with increasing northerly winds Christmas Day and Boxing Day with a strong, westerly change on Thursday.
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell until 2.30pm today, Tuesday 24 December 2024. This relief centre will be unstaffed until 6.00am Thursday 26 December. People requiring immediate assistance can utilise the contacts listed on the door.
Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area

Impacts in your area:

  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
    Grampians National Park visitor information:
  • The Grampians National Park is CLOSED.

    COMMUNITY MEETING
    Date: Tuesday 24 December 2024
    Venue: Moyston Hall        
               12 Brooke St           
               Moyston  VIC  3377
    Time: 11am
    This meeting is being live streamed on via the Ararat Rural City Council Facebook page and will be shared to the Vic Emergency Facebook page
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 25/12/2024 09:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Cabbage Tree, Chapel Flat, Clarkes Hill, Dean, Glen Park, Springmount, Wattle Flat. 

  • There is a bushfire at Melbourne Rd, Creswick that is contained.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.  
  • Firefighters continue to work in the area.
  • Check road signage for temporary speed restrictions near the fire.
  • This Community Information replaces the Community Information issued at 12.57pm on 23rd December 2024.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 25/12/2024 01:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Rosebud.

  • Emergency services are on scene of a natural gas leak in Mclaren Court, Rosebud. 
  • The gas company is attending to isolate the leak. 
  • Residents should remain indoors. 
There is currently no threat to the community, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do:
  • You should follow the instructions of police and emergency services who are at the scene.
  • Residents should remain indoors.
Impacts in your area:
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
  • Power and gas services have been impacted. 
This message was issued by Fire Rescue Victoria.

The next update is expected by 24/12/2024 10:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Fyans Creek, Lake Lonsdale, Mokepilly, Mount Dryden, Wartook, Zumsteins, Ledcourt
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Fyans Creek, Lake Lonsdale, Ledcourt, Mokepilly, Mount Dryden, Wartook, Zumsteins.

  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 4.41pm on Sunday 22 December 2024
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling in a northerly direction
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Milder weather conditions overnight saw a reduction in fire activity. Weather conditions today will be milder however winds can be stronger and erratic at elevation so please be aware of conditions in your area
  • Weather forecasts indicate warmer temperatures with increasing northerly winds Christmas Day and Boxing Day with a strong, westerly change on Thursday.
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell until 2.30pm today, Tuesday 24 December 2024. This relief centre will be unstaffed until 6.00am Thursday 26 December. People requiring immediate assistance can utilise the contacts listed on the door. 
Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.
Impacts in your area: 
Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 

Road Closures:
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

Grampians National Park Visitor Information:
The Grampians National Park is closed to visitors. For further details please visit the website: Parks Victoria - Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 25/12/2024 10:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Pioneer Bay, St Helier, The Gurdies, Grantville, Jam Jerrup, Lang Lang, Woodleigh
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Grantville, Jam Jerrup, Lang Lang, Pioneer Bay, St Helier, The Gurdies, Woodleigh. 

  • There is a bushfire at The Gurdies that is not yet under control.
  • The mild weather conditions over the past few days have resulted in a reduction in fire activity.
  • Ground crews are currently working around the fire edge to extinguish hot spots.
  • There is currently no threat to communities, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
ROADS:
  • The Bass Highway dual carriageway is now open in both directions and previous speed restrictions have been lifted
  • Gurdies-St Heliers Road is now open. A 40km/h speed limit applies.
  • This Community Information replaces the Community Information issued at 4PM on December 23, 2024.
FORECAST CONDITIONS - CHRISTMAS DAY & BOXING DAY
  • Although there is no immediate threat to the community you should review and update your fire plan now as the situation may change over the next couple of days.
  • Significantly warmer weather with strong and gusty north to north westerly winds are forecast for Boxing Day (26, December).  
  • Due to the increased fire risk a total fire ban has been issued for all of Victoria from midnight on 25 December to midnight on 26 December 2024.

This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by Wednesday, December 25 at 5.00PM or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.location: Barton, Jallukar, Londonderry, Moyston, Rhymney, Watgania, Willaura North, Black Range, Great Western, Mafeking
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bellellen, Black Range, Great Western, Jallukar, Lake Fyans, Londonderry, Moyston, Rhymney, Willaura North.  

  • This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 6.00pm Monday 23 December 2024.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
  • This fire is currently travelling in a northerly direction
  • Moderate weather conditions last night and this morning has slowed the spread of fire for now, but the situation can change at any time.
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Weather forecasts indicate warmer temperatures with increasing northerly winds Christmas Day and Boxing Day with a strong, westerly change on Thursday.
  • Considering the potential increase in fire activity on Boxing Day, please restrict any travel on the roads
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area or Stawell or Ararat.

Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. Companion animals are welcome, but must remain on a lead at all times. Please ensure you bring any necessary items for them such as food and water bowl.
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell until 2.30pm today, Tuesday 24 December 2024. This relief centre will be unstaffed until 6.00am Thursday 26 December. People requiring immediate assistance can utilise the contacts listed on the door. 
Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.

  • Register at a relief centre so your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
  • The Australian Red Cross's Register Find Reunite service has been activated.
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings
  • You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
Impacts in your area:
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
    Grampians National Park visitor information:
  • The Grampians National Park is CLOSED.


This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 25/12/2024 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bullengarook.

  • The bushfire at Bullengarook has been contained but is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire started near Coffeys Road and is burning within the Wombat State Forest.
  • Crews will continue working over the coming days to make the fire safe.
  • Extreme fire weather expected on Thursday may increase the risk to life and property south and east of the fire.
  • You should plan to leave early, before conditions become too dangerous.
Stay informed, monitor conditions and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • Leaving early is the safest option.
  • Find information on protecting yourself and your family: http://www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/before-and-during-a-fire 
  • Monitor weather conditions and be ready to act. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, seeing smoke and having poor visibility all indicate the situation is changing.
  • Listen to ABC Central Victoria 91.1FM or ABC Radio Melbourne 774 AM. 
  • Take your phone off silent and make sure notifications are turned on. 
  • Have a battery powered radio on hand and spare batteries or use the car radio to stay informed. 
  • Reach out to your neighbours, friends and family to make sure they are aware of the situation. 
  • When leaving, open all internal gates to allow stock and animals to move freely around your property if threatened by fire, however leave external gates closed.
People who intend to stay must:
  • Be physically and mentally prepared to be isolated and come under threat. 
  • Have a comprehensive plan, drinking water supply, equipment and a survival place of last resort. 
  • Have prepared inside and outside their house, including pets, animals, equipment and vehicles. 
  • Remember fire trucks will be concentrating on stopping the fire spread and not necessarily protecting individual properties.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Smoke may be more visible to nearby communities during the warmer and windier parts of the day, typically afternoons.
  • Coffeys Road, Carrolls Lane and Waterloo Flat Road are closed.
  • Numerous tracks within the Wombat State Forest are closed, including Finger Post Road and a number of adjoining tracks.
  • If you are travelling, plan ahead. Check Fire Danger Ratings and check the VicTraffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
Pyschosocial support:
This festive season may be particularly stressful for communities impacted by bushfires. If you or someone you know is feeling overwhelmed, or just need someone to talk to, there are free 24/7 supports available. 
  • Lifeline 13 11 14 
  • Beyond Blue 1300 22 4636 
  • Kids Helpline 1800 55 1800
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 26/12/2024 10:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

  • Milder weather conditions overnight saw a reduction in fire activity. Weather conditions today will be milder however winds can be stronger and erratic at elevation so please be aware of conditions in your area
  • Weather forecasts indicate warmer temperatures with increasing northerly winds Christmas Day and Boxing Day with a strong, westerly change on Thursday .
  • Considering the potential increase in fire activity on Boxing Day, please restrict any travel on the roads
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Find information on protecting yourself and your family: www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/before-and-during-a-fire

Relief Centre locations:

Ararat - Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Register your attendance at Ararat via this link
  • Companion animals are welcome, but must remain on a lead at all times.   Please ensure you bring any necessary items for your animals such as food, water bowl and bedding. 
Stawell - Grampians Community Health (known as "The Shacc")22 Patrick Street Stawell until 2.30pm today, Tuesday 24 December 2024, after this time the relief centre will be unstaffed until 6.00am Thursday 26 December. 
  • Register your attendance at Stawell via this link
  • People requiring immediate assistance can utilise the contacts listed on the door. 
Anyone can register with Red Cross via the Register.Find.Reunite so your family and friends can find you.  
Impacts in your area: 

  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

    Grampians National Park visitor information: 
  • The Grampians National Park is closed.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 25/12/2024 03:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Issue Date: Tuesday 24 December 2024, 02:24 pm
Next Update: Wednesday 25 December 2024, 03:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35300/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Bornes Hill, Dunkeld, Glenthompson, Grampians, Jimmy Creek, Karabeal, Mirranatwa, Strathmore, Victoria Point, Victoria Valley.
- There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd that is not yet under control.
- This fire is currently travelling in a northerly direction



There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Kia Ora, Willaura.


  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 1.25pm on Monday 23 December 2024.
  • There is a bushfire in the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling  in a northerly direction 


There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Milder conditions overnight and this morning have seen a reduction in fire activity however you still need to stay informed and be aware of the conditions in your area.
  • Weather forecasts indicate warmer temperatures with increasing northerly winds Christmas Day and Boxing Day with a strong, westerly change on Thursday
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions.
Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell until 2.30pm today, Tuesday 24 December 2024. This relief centre will be unstaffed until 6.00am Thursday 26 December. People requiring immediate assistance can utilise the contacts listed on the door. Animals are welcome.
Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.

Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke will visible from nearby communities and roads
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
 
Road Closures:
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

Grampians National Park Visitor Information:
The Grampians National Park is closed to visitors. For further details please visit the website: Parks Victoria - Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park 

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 25/12/2024 11:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Grampians Junction, Halls Gap, Fyans Creek
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Fyans Creek, Grampians Junction, Halls Gap. 
  • It is Not Safe to Return to Halls Gap.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling in a northerly direction.

This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 12.25 Tuesday 24 December 2024
If you left Halls Gap, it is not safe to return. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
What you should do:

If you have not already left: 
  • Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance.
If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.
Relief Centre locations: 
Ararat - Alexandra Oval Community Centre 
1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
Register your attendance at Ararat via this link
Companion animals are welcome, but must remain on a lead at all times.  Please ensure you bring any necessary items for your animals such as food, water bowl and bedding. 

Stawell - Grampians Community Health (known as "The Shacc")
22 Patrick Street Stawell is unstaffed from 2.30pm Tuesday 24 December 2024, until 6.00am Thursday 26 December. 
Register your attendance at Stawell via this link
People requiring immediate assistance can utilise the contacts listed on the door. Pets are welcome, please ensure they are on a lead at all times. 

Anyone can register with Red Cross via the Register.Find.Reunite so your family and friends can find you.  

Always remember to stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Impacts in your area:
    Check the VicTraffic website  (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
    The Grampians National Park is closed. Check the Parks Victoria website for details 
    A community meeting was hall Tuesday 24 December in Moyston you can access a recording of this meeting via VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook page.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 25/12/2024 11:50 am or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
